page.title: 08A Woodcarving Craftsman
page.content: Mr.Hunstone is a wood carver.He has been doing this for 35 years.His grandfather was a stonemason.He used to do a lot for churches,and used to enjoy carving statues.Hunstone carvings can be found in churches all over the country. Now he makes mostly chairs,tables and chests. He uses English oak for carvings.Oak has been used traditionally for church carving, because there was a lot of it and it resists wood worm. Some of the tools he uses are gouges and maccaroni and a V too.He learnt this craft from his father. He started when he left school.During the war, ('39 -'45) he joined the Royal Air Force. Afterwards he became a teacher. Later he became a wood carver. His family originated in Boston in Lincolnshire,although they have lived in Tideswell for 300 years.
